â
'''Donald John Trump, Sr.''' (born June 14, 1946) is a prominent American [[business magnate]], author, and [[Celebrity|television personality]]. He is the [[Chairman]] and [[CEO]] of the [[Trump Organization]], a [[real-estate developer]] based in the [[United States]]. Trump is also the founder of [[Trump Entertainment Resorts]], which operates numerous [[casino]]s and [[hotels]] across the world. Trump's extravagant lifestyle and outspoken manner have made him a celebrity for years, and more recently with his [[NBC]] [[reality television|reality show]], ''[[The Apprentice (US TV series)|The Apprentice]]'', where he serves as host and [[executive producer]]. Trump has expressed interest in becoming a candidate for [[President of the United States]] in 2012.<ref name=post>[http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/donald_trump_seriously_considers_HpwRnhtvmQ2UcNKIcCZxvI Donald Trump seriously considers running for President in 2012]. New York Post October 5, 2010. Retrieved January 30, 2010.</ref><ref name="Feb2011poll">{{cite web|url=http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2011/02/22/poll-could-trump-beat-obama-in-2012/ |title=Poll: "Could Trump beat Obama in 2012?" |publisher=Politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com |date=2011-02-22 |accessdate=2011-04-21}}</ref>
+
'''Donald John Trump, Sr.''' (born June 14, 1946) is an American [[business magnate]], author, and [[Celebrity|television personality]]. He is the [[Chairman]] and [[CEO]] of the [[Trump Organization]], a [[real-estate developer]] based in the [[United States]]. Trump is also the founder of [[Trump Entertainment Resorts]], which operates numerous [[casino]]s and [[hotels]] across the world. Trump's extravagant lifestyle and outspoken manner have made him a celebrity for years, and more recently with his [[NBC]] [[reality television|reality show]], ''[[The Apprentice (US TV series)|The Apprentice]]'', where he serves as host and [[executive producer]]. Trump has expressed interest in becoming a candidate for [[President of the United States]] in 2012.<ref name=post>[http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/donald_trump_seriously_considers_HpwRnhtvmQ2UcNKIcCZxvI Donald Trump seriously considers running for President in 2012]. New York Post October 5, 2010. Retrieved January 30, 2010.</ref><ref name="Feb2011poll">{{cite web|url=http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2011/02/22/poll-could-trump-beat-obama-in-2012/ |title=Poll: "Could Trump beat Obama in 2012?" |publisher=Politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com |date=2011-02-22 |accessdate=2011-04-21}}</ref>
Trump is the fourth of five children of [[Fred Trump]], a real-estate developer based in New York City and real estate tycoon. Donald was inspired to follow his father into real-estate development,<ref name="bio">{{cite web|title=Donald(John) Trump biography|work=biography.com|url=http://www.biography.com/search/article.do?id=9511238| accessdate=2008-07-06}}</ref> and began working on projects for his father's real-estate firm while still in college. Upon his graduation from the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton School]] of the [[University of Pennsylvania]] in 1968, Trump formally joined his father's company, Elizabeth Trump & Son.<ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=Ye6e_VxM00kC&pg=PA67&lpg=PA67#v=onepage&q&f=false|page = 67|first1 = Donald|last1 = Trump|first2 = Tony|last2 = Schwartz|title = The Art of the Deal|year = 1987|publisher = [[Random House]]}}</ref> He took the helm in 1971 and renamed it [[The Trump Organization]].<ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=AiFeQZhakXQC&pg=PA23#v=onepage&q&f=false|page = 23|first = Gwenda|last = Blair|title = Donald Trump: Master Apprenticel|year = 2000, 2005|publisher = [[Simon & Schuster]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=Ye6e_VxM00kC&pg=PA105#v=onepage&q=trump%20organization&f=false|page = 105|first1 = Donald|last1 = Trump|first2 = Tony|last2 = Schwartz|title = The Art of the Deal|year = 1987|publisher = [[Random House]]}}</ref>
Trump is the fourth of five children of [[Fred Trump]], a real-estate developer based in New York City and real estate tycoon. Donald was inspired to follow his father into real-estate development,<ref name="bio">{{cite web|title=Donald(John) Trump biography|work=biography.com|url=http://www.biography.com/search/article.do?id=9511238| accessdate=2008-07-06}}</ref> and began working on projects for his father's real-estate firm while still in college. Upon his graduation from the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton School]] of the [[University of Pennsylvania]] in 1968, Trump formally joined his father's company, Elizabeth Trump & Son.<ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=Ye6e_VxM00kC&pg=PA67&lpg=PA67#v=onepage&q&f=false|page = 67|first1 = Donald|last1 = Trump|first2 = Tony|last2 = Schwartz|title = The Art of the Deal|year = 1987|publisher = [[Random House]]}}</ref> He took the helm in 1971 and renamed it [[The Trump Organization]].<ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=AiFeQZhakXQC&pg=PA23#v=onepage&q&f=false|page = 23|first = Gwenda|last = Blair|title = Donald Trump: Master Apprenticel|year = 2000, 2005|publisher = [[Simon & Schuster]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url = http://books.google.com/books?id=Ye6e_VxM00kC&pg=PA105#v=onepage&q=trump%20organization&f=false|page = 105|first1 = Donald|last1 = Trump|first2 = Tony|last2 = Schwartz|title = The Art of the Deal|year = 1987|publisher = [[Random House]]}}</ref>
Line 34: Line 34:
In his book, ''Trump: The Art of the Deal'', Trump discusses his undergraduate career: "After I graduated from the New York Military Academy in 1964, I flirted briefly with the idea of attending film school... but in the end I decided real estate was a much better business. I began by attending Fordham University... but after two years, I decided that as long as I had to be in college, I might as well test myself against the best. I applied to the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton School]] at the [[University of Pennsylvania]] and I got in...I was also very glad to get finished. I immediately moved back home and went to work full time with my father." {{Citation needed|date=February 2011}}
In his book, ''Trump: The Art of the Deal'', Trump discusses his undergraduate career: "After I graduated from the New York Military Academy in 1964, I flirted briefly with the idea of attending film school... but in the end I decided real estate was a much better business. I began by attending Fordham University... but after two years, I decided that as long as I had to be in college, I might as well test myself against the best. I applied to the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton School]] at the [[University of Pennsylvania]] and I got in...I was also very glad to get finished. I immediately moved back home and went to work full time with my father." {{Citation needed|date=February 2011}}
==Personal life==
==Personal life==
â
[[File:Donald Trump announcing latest David Blaine feat 3-alt.jpg|thumb|<center>Donald Trump<center/>]]
+
[[File:Donald Trump announcing latest David Blaine feat 3-alt.jpg|thumb|Trump's "lattice-like" double [[comb over]]]]
Trump is popularly known as '''The Donald,''' a nickname given to him by the media after his first wife [[Ivana Trump]], a native of the [[Czech Republic]], referred to him as such in an interview.<ref name="Observer">{{cite web|work=[[The New York Observer]]|title=Trump vs Trump in Battle of the Exes|url=http://www.observer.com/node/40991|accessdate=2008-05-22}}</ref> Trump is also known for his catchphrase, "You're fired", made popular by his television series ''The Apprentice'', and his "possibly unprecedented" double [[comb over]] hairstyle in a "lattice-like structure",<ref name="handy20110331">{{cite web | url=http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2011/03/shocking-truth-behind-donald-trumps-hair-revealed.html | title=Shocking Truth Behind Donald Trumpâs Hair Revealed? | accessdate=April 3, 2011 | author=Handy, Bruce | date=2011-03-31 | work=Vanity Fair | publisher=CondÃ© Nast}}</ref> which he has refused to change throughout his career. While it has been reported that Trump does not shake hands because of fear of germs,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,992254,00.html|title=My Evening with Donald Trump|date=1999-10-18|accessdate=2010-08-06|author=Carlson, Margaret|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]}}</ref> he claims this phobia is "a rumor that the enemies say", and shook hands repeatedly in public during a visit to [[New Hampshire]] in April 2011.<ref name="viser20110428">{{cite news | url=http://www.boston.com/news/politics/articles/2011/04/28/trump_brings_his_buzz_tour_to_nh/ | title=Trump brings his buzz tour to N.H. | work=The Boston Globe | date=2011-04-28 | accessdate=April 28, 2011 | author=Viser, Matt}}</ref>
Trump is popularly known as '''The Donald,''' a nickname given to him by the media after his first wife [[Ivana Trump]], a native of the [[Czech Republic]], referred to him as such in an interview.<ref name="Observer">{{cite web|work=[[The New York Observer]]|title=Trump vs Trump in Battle of the Exes|url=http://www.observer.com/node/40991|accessdate=2008-05-22}}</ref> Trump is also known for his catchphrase, "You're fired", made popular by his television series ''The Apprentice'', and his "possibly unprecedented" double [[comb over]] hairstyle in a "lattice-like structure",<ref name="handy20110331">{{cite web | url=http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2011/03/shocking-truth-behind-donald-trumps-hair-revealed.html | title=Shocking Truth Behind Donald Trumpâs Hair Revealed? | accessdate=April 3, 2011 | author=Handy, Bruce | date=2011-03-31 | work=Vanity Fair | publisher=CondÃ© Nast}}</ref> which he has refused to change throughout his career. While it has been reported that Trump does not shake hands because of fear of germs,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,992254,00.html|title=My Evening with Donald Trump|date=1999-10-18|accessdate=2010-08-06|author=Carlson, Margaret|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]}}</ref> he claims this phobia is "a rumor that the enemies say", and shook hands repeatedly in public during a visit to [[New Hampshire]] in April 2011.<ref name="viser20110428">{{cite news | url=http://www.boston.com/news/politics/articles/2011/04/28/trump_brings_his_buzz_tour_to_nh/ | title=Trump brings his buzz tour to N.H. | work=The Boston Globe | date=2011-04-28 | accessdate=April 28, 2011 | author=Viser, Matt}}</ref>
Line 256: Line 256:
On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, President Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they granted through special waivers.
On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, President Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they granted through special waivers.
â
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided the 'long form' birth certificate to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirmed details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump credited the release to his efforts. In the April 27 press conference, Trump also voiced questions about whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref>
+
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided the 'long form' birth certificate to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirmed details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump credited the release to his efforts.
  +   +
In the April 27 press conference, Trump also voiced questions about whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref> In specific response to Trump's claims about Obama's education, Bob Schieffer of CBS News explicitly characterized Trump's behavior as racist. Said Schieffer: "That's just code for saying he got into law school because he's black. This is an ugly strain of racism that's running through this whole thing".<ref name=Schieffer />
